intro: Samyda glabrata, commonly known as the smooth samyda, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It often grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. The plant's botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
